io.spine.server.delivery

Class AbstractWorkRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.delivery.AbstractWorkRegistry
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ShardedWorkRegistry

    @SPI
public abstract class AbstractWorkRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
implements ShardedWorkRegistry
    An implementation base for ShardedWorkRegistries based on a specific persistence mechanism.
    Implementation Note:
    This class is NOT thread safe. Synchronize the atomic persistence operations as well as the methods implemented in this class make an implementation thread safe.

    • Method Detail

      • pickUp

        public java.util.Optional<ShardProcessingSession> pickUp(io.spine.server.delivery.ShardIndex index,
                                                         io.spine.server.NodeId nodeId)
        Description copied from interface: ShardedWorkRegistry
        Picks up the shard at a given index to process.

        This action is intended to be exclusive, i.e. a single shard may be served by a single application node at a given moment of time.

        In case of a successful operation, an instance of ShardProcessingSession is returned. The node obtained the session should perform the desired actions with the sharded messages and then complete the session.

        In case the shard at a given index is already picked up by some node, an Optional.empty() is returned.

        Specified by:
        pickUp in interface ShardedWorkRegistry
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the shard to pick up for processing
        nodeId - the identifier of the node for which to pick the shard
        Returns:
        the session of shard processing, or Optional.empty() if the shard is not available

      • releaseExpiredSessions

        public java.lang.Iterable<io.spine.server.delivery.ShardIndex> releaseExpiredSessions(com.google.protobuf.Duration inactivityPeriod)
        Description copied from interface: ShardedWorkRegistry
        Clears up the recorded NodeIds from the session records if there was no activity for longer than passed inactivityPeriod.

        It may be handy if an application node hangs or gets killed — so that it is not able to complete the session in a conventional way.

        Specified by:
        releaseExpiredSessions in interface ShardedWorkRegistry
        Parameters:
        inactivityPeriod - the duration of the period after which the session is considered expired
        Returns:
        the indexes of shards which sessions have been released

      • clearNode

        protected void clearNode(io.spine.server.delivery.ShardSessionRecord session)
        Clears the value of ShardSessionRecord.when_last_picked and stores the session.

      • allRecords

        protected abstract java.util.Iterator<io.spine.server.delivery.ShardSessionRecord> allRecords()
        Obtains all the session records associated with this registry.

      • write

        protected abstract void write(io.spine.server.delivery.ShardSessionRecord session)
        Stores the given session.

        The session may or may be not present in the registry already. After calling this method, the given session must be reachable via AbstractWorkRegistry.find(ShardIndex) and AbstractWorkRegistry.allRecords().

      • find

        protected abstract java.util.Optional<io.spine.server.delivery.ShardSessionRecord> find(io.spine.server.delivery.ShardIndex index)
        Looks for the session record by the given shard index.
        Parameters:
        index - shard index to find a session for
        Returns:
        a session record or Optional.empty() if the record is not present in the registry

      • asSession

        protected abstract ShardProcessingSession asSession(io.spine.server.delivery.ShardSessionRecord record)
        Restores a ShardProcessingSession from the given session record.
